[[File:LittleBigPlanet_Screenshot_1.jpg|thumb|300px|Players doing parkour in the [[LittleBigPlanet Mash-up]].]]
A '''mash-up''' or '''mash-up pack''' is a type of [[DLC]] available in the {{els|be|lce|3ds}} of ''Minecraft'', that bundles different types of downloadable content together. Mash-up packs normally include modifications to the title screen, a [[skin pack]], a [[texture pack (downloadable content)|texture pack]], and a themed world; many also include themed music tracks or make them available for download.<ref>{{tweet|4jstudios|360361438247788547|A Mash-up Pack makes Minecraft look like another game, so Texture Pack + Skin Pack + User Interface + Music + Themed World <nowiki>#</nowiki>MinecraftXBLA|July 25, 2013}}</ref>

Mash-up packs can be purchased on the ''Minecraft'' [[Marketplace]] or through the platform's storefront ({{in|LCE}}).

The Chinese Mythology Texture Pack is themed around characters and events from Chinese mythology. It was first added to Legacy Console Edition, and then later to Bedrock Edition.

==== On Bedrock Edition ====

The Chinese Mythology Texture Pack was released on April 11, 2017, as part of the [[Pocket Edition 1.0.6|1.0.6]] update, and has 41 skins to choose from. It is purchasable directly in-game through the Minecraft Marketplace under the main menu of the game and costs {{Price|coin=960}}.<ref>[https://minecraft.net/article/chinese-myth-now-pocket-and-win-10 CHINESE MYTH NOW ON POCKET AND WIN 10] –  minecraft.net</ref>

==== On Legacy Console Edition ====

The Chinese Mythology Texture Pack was released on October 4, 2016, as part of a free update, and has 41 skins to choose from. It is purchasable through the [http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/Minecraft-Chinese-Mythology-Mash-Up/67d7db92-8673-4ed8-8a98-4eea6cfd5e98 Xbox 360] or [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/p/minecraft-chinese-mythology-mash-up/bw8qvzp4gt6s One Marketplace]/PlayStation Store/Nintendo eShop or directly in-game through the Downloadable Content section of the game and costs {{Price|4.99}}.<ref>[http://news.xbox.com/2016/09/24/explore-ancient-world-october-4-minecraft-chinese-mythology-mash-pack/ Explore an Ancient World on October 4 in the Minecraft Chinese Mythology Mash-Up Pack] — Xbox Wire</ref>

{{CollapsedVideo|sNcVYOPw6r0|Trailer for ''Super Mario'' Mash-up pack}}
The ''Super Mario'' Mash-up Pack is based on the video game series of the same name owned by Nintendo. As such, this mashup pack can only be downloaded and used on their consoles.

==== On Bedrock Edition (Nintendo Switch) ====
The ''Super Mario'' Mash-up Pack was released on Bedrock Edition on June 21, 2018 exclusive for Nintendo Switch. It and the ''LittleBigPlanet'' Mash-up Pack for PS4 are the only Mash-up Packs on Bedrock Edition that are limited to a certain platform. The Nintendo Switch version of Bedrock Edition, like the legacy Nintendo Switch Edition, comes bundled with the ''Super Mario'' Mash-up Pack.

==== On Legacy Console Edition (Wii U) ====
The ''Super Mario'' Mash-up Pack was released on May 17, 2016 as part of a free update exclusive to Wii U Edition. It was released on the Nintendo Switch Edition when it launched on May 11, 2017. It was exclusively on the Wii U and Nintendo Switch, and was bundled with both versions of the game. This mash-up adds in new skins, textures, and a pre-built world themed around the ''Super Mario'' franchise, along with an original soundtrack from ''Super Mario 64''.<ref>[https://play.nintendo.com/news-tips/news/minecraft-wii-u-super-mario-mashup-resource-pack/ Mario Meets Minecraft] – Nintendo</ref>

==== On New Nintendo 3DS Edition ====
The ''Super Mario'' Mash-up Pack was released on June 5, 2018, as part a free update exclusive to New Nintendo 3DS Edition. It is the first mash-up pack to be released on the system, and is the same as the Bedrock Edition and Legacy Console Edition versions.

The Halloween Mash-up Pack was released on October 23, 2015, and is based on the Halloween holiday, originally known as All Hallows' Eve. It is purchasable through the [http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/Halloween-2015-Mash-up-Pack/33ddc744-260d-429c-8e77-0f89b6026c90 Xbox 360] or [https://www.xbox.com/games/store/halloween-mash-up-pack/brqwglbsrnz5 One Marketplace]/PlayStation Store/Nintendo eShop or directly in-game through the Downloadable Content section of the game and costs {{Price|5.99}}.<ref>[http://news.xbox.com/2015/10/games-minecraft-console-editions-halloween-mashup-pack Prepare for Scares with the Halloween Mashup Pack for Minecraft: Console Editions] – Xbox Wire</ref>

==== On Bedrock Edition ====

The textures are missing the orange skybox, the lighting and the fog as well as purple clouds. Some of the paintings and other minor textures appear as regular vanilla textures.

==== On Legacy Edition ====

Everything is fine and nothing is missing, since the Mash-Up Pack was made for the older version of Minecraft. Bedrock Edition has the issues listed above.

{{CollapsedVideo|KBE5mskiV1I|Trailer for ''Halo'' Mash-up pack}}

The ''Halo'' Mash-up Pack was released on May 27, 2014 and is based on ''[[wikipedia:Halo (series)|Halo]]'', developed by Bungie and 343 Industries. It has 40 skins to choose from, and contains a world with unique textures with iconic locations from the ''Halo'' franchise. It’s purchasable through the [http://marketplace.xbox.com/en-US/Product/Halo-Mash-up/b79ba4fb-4c84-45de-ad1d-6bec1209e250 Xbox 360] or 
[https://www.xbox.com/games/store/master-chief-mash-up/bz1m94jllg5l One Marketplace] or directly in-game through the Downloadable Content section of the game and costs {{Price|5.99}}.<ref>[http://news.xbox.com/2014/05/games-minecraft-halo-mash-up Halo Arrives on Minecraft: Xbox 360 Edition] – Xbox Wire</ref>

==== ''Halo 5: Guardians'' update ====

The ''Halo 5: Guardians'' update was released on October 28, 2015 and is based on ''Halo 5: Guardians'', developed by 343 Industries. It is downloadable through the Xbox 360 or One Marketplace or directly in-game through the Downloadable Content section of the game and is a free update to the ''Halo'' Mash-up pack.<ref>[http://news.xbox.com/2015/10/19/halo-5-guardians-lands-this-week-on-minecraft-for-xbox/ Halo 5: Guardians Lands This Week on Minecraft for Xbox] – Xbox Wire</ref>

==== ''Halo: Infinite'' update ====

The ''Halo: Infinite'' update was released on December 10, 2021 and is based on ''Halo: Infinite'', developed by 343 Industries. It is downloadable through the Xbox Marketplace or directly in-game through the Minecraft Marketplace and is a free update to the ''Halo'' Mash-up pack.

It is based on the ''LittleBigPlanet'' game series, developed by Media Molecule. ==Trivia==
*The “vengeful spirit” from the Halloween mashup pack strongly resembles [[Wikipedia:Sadako Yamamura|Sadako Yamamura]] from ''The Ring''.
*The zombies in the Greek mythology pack resemble [[Wikipedia:satyrs|satyrs]].
*The slimes in the Greek mythology pack resemble [[Wikipedia:gorgons|gorgons]].
*The “sacred cow of Apollo” resembles the [[Cow variant|warm variant cows]] added to the base game years later.
*Despite being featured in the Greek mythology pack, the Kraken is actually part of Nordic mythology.
*The Fallout pack image is clearly based on ''[[Wikipedia:Fallout:New Vegas|Fallout:New Vegas]]'', with the Courier and Dogmeat walking towards a Red Rocket gas station in the Mojave Wasteland.
*The ''Star Wars'' pack looks vastly different from previous ''Star Wars'' crossover packs, with much more detailed and realistic character designs.
